central bank.translation[0].definitions[: a national bank that does business with the government, and controls the amount of money available and the general system of banks
central bank.translation[1].definitions[: the official bank of a country, which is responsible for setting interest rates, controlling the MONEY SUPPLY, producing banknotes and making money available, and keeping the country’s supply of foreign currency and gold etc
China’s central bank said that a further decline in interest rates is unlikely.
Germany has no plans to sell gold from its central bank reserves.
